name: Challenge!

historicalClassification.note: Originally printed as a Trainer. Would be classified as Item by modern rules.

effect.text: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pok√©mon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

tips: Use when you have more bench space than opponent
Draw 2 if opponent declines or can't accept
Good for setting up multiple evolution lines

competitiveHistory: Challenge! was a unique interactive card. If your opponent declined, you drew 2 cards. If they accepted, both players could fill their benches with Basic Pokemon. This created interesting strategic decisions about when to play it.

rulings.ruling: If both benches are full, the card automatically gives you 2 cards - no choice is offered.
Both players search and place cards face down before revealing, so neither sees the other's choices during selection.
A player with a full bench when the challenge is accepted simply doesn't search.
